data.title: Oswald moves to New Orleans
data.text: Oswald moves to New Orleans, and finds employment at the William B. Riley Coffee Company. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 320

data.title: General Walker shot
data.text: General Walker shot at in his home. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 319

data.title: Kennedy, Johnson, Connelly met
data.text:
Decision for Texas trip made at meeting with Kennedy, Johnson,
        and Connelly at the Cortez hotel in El Paso Texas. <i>ref. W.C.<i>

data.title: Maurice Bishop seen speaking to Oswald
data.text: Antonio Veciana travels to Dallas for a meeting with Maurice Bishop (a.k.a. David Atlee Philips). In the lobby of the Southland building, Veciana sees Bishop speaking to a man Veciana later identifies as Lee Harvey Oswald. ref. Last Investigation, p 141

data.title: CIA\'s growth a malignancy
data.text: Reporter Arther Krock, citing a dispatch from Vietnam reporter Richard Starnes, writes, "The CIA\'s growth was likened to a malignancy which the very high official was not sure even the White House could control any longer. If the United States ever experiences an attempt at a coup to overthrow the government it will come from the CIA and not the Pentagon. The agency represents a tremendous power and total unaccountability to anyone". ref. Last Investigation, p 422

data.title: Kennedy signs NSAM 263
data.text: Kennedy signs National Security Action Memorandum (NSAM) #263, signalling his intention to withdraw troops from Vietnam. ref. JFK, CIA, Vietnam by Prouty, p xxiii

data.title: Oswald begins job at TSBD
data.text: Oswald begins job at Texas School Book Depository. He reportedly obtained it through a contact of Ruth Paine. ref. Last Investigation, p 422

data.title: Oswald purchased rifle
data.text: Ruth Paine makes notation on her calendar \'LHO purchase of rifle.\' ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 293

data.title: Lawson receives Texas trip schedule
data.text:
SS Agent Winston Lawson is briefed and receives a tentative
        schedule of Texas trip from SS Agent Roy H Kellerman who was
        the agent in charge of arranging the timetable for trip and
        responsible for motorcade route.

data.title: Governor Connelly confirms trip
data.text: Governor Connelly confirms trip to Dallas on November 21 - 22, 1963. ref. W.C.

data.title: Oswald writes to Mr. Hunt
data.text: Oswald writes to, "Dear Mr. Hunt, (most likely Howard E. Hunt) I would like more information concerning my position. I am asking only for information. I am suggesting that we discuss the matter fully before any steps are taken by me or anyone else. Thank you, Lee Harvey Oswald." ref. Last Investigation, p 423; Treachery in Dallas, p 324; Crossfire (letter shown in full)

data.title: Oswald delivers note to Dallas FBI HQ
data.text: Oswald delivers a note to Dallas FBI HQ where Agent James Hosty is told to destroy it by Special Agent in Charge, Gordin Shanklin. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 261

data.title: SS Agents Lawson and Sorrels test-drive route
data.text: SS Agents Lawson and Sorrels drive route from Lovefield to Trademart which went down Main street to Stemmons freeway. ref. W.C.

data.title: Motorcade route reviewed, unchanged
data.text: Motorcade route reviewed but was unchanged. ref. W.C.

data.title: Dallas Times Herald reports route
data.text: Dallas Times Herald reported that the Presidential motorcade "apparently will loop through downtown area, probably on Main street on its way to Trade Mart". ref. W.C.

data.title: FBI calls to determine potential threat
data.text: An FBI teletype is received, directed to all field offices to contact CIs (confidential informants) to determine whether a revolutionary group was a potential threat to the president during his Dallas trip November 22 - 23. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 77

data.title: Motorcade timing verified
data.text: SS Agents Lawson and Sorrels with Dallas police assistant Chief Charles Batchelor drive motorcade route verifying that it could be driven in 45 minutes and was unchanged. ref. W.C.

data.title: Newspaper published precise route
data.text: Newspaper published precise route mentioning the turn into Elm into Houston then onto the freeway. ref. W.C.

data.title: Mock target practice witnessed
data.text: Two Dallas police officers witness a "mock target practice" going on at the picket fence atop the knoll. They arrived in time to see the partipants depart in haste, and only write a report of the incedent subsequent to November 22. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 132

data.title: Motorcade route on front page
data.text: Newspaper reports motorcade route on front page. ref. W.C.

data.title: Rose Cheramie warns of assassination
data.text: Rose Cheramie is thrown from a car, taken to hospital, and while there tells doctors that JFK is going to be killed in Dallas. ref. Crossfire, p 401

data.title: Bundy signs 1st draft of NSAM 273
data.text: McGeorge Bundy, then assistant to President Kennedy, signs the key first draft of NSAM 273, in contradiction to all previous Kennedy policy. ref. JFK, CIA Vietnam by Prouty, p xii

data.title: Man with rifle spotted on Elm St.
data.text: Julia Ann Mercer drives down Elm street, her way is blocked by a green Ford pickup truck. A young man removes a long paper bag, she can see the outline of a rifle in the bag, and he walks with it to the top of the grassy knoll. She also sees the driver of the truck, whom she later identifies as Jack Ruby (before he shot Oswald). ref. Crossfire, p 18

data.title: Air Force One leaves Fort Worth
data.text: Air Force One leaves Carswell AFB Fort Worth for 13 min flight to Lovefield Airport.

data.title: Motorcade leaves Lovefield Airport
data.text: Presidential Motorcade leaves Lovefield Airport. ref. W.C.

data.title: Oswald alone in TSBD
data.text: Oswald is left on sixth floor of the TSBD as fellow workmates leave to go to Lunch break. He yells, "Guys, How about an elevator?" And then adding "Send one of the elevators back up". ref. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 106

data.title: Oswald near telephone in TSBD
data.text: TSBD foreman Bill Shelley said he saw Oswald near the telephone on the first floor. ref. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 107

data.title: Jack Ruby seen with Wanda Walker
data.text: Jack Ruby is seen sitting in an office at the Dallas Morning News by newspaper employee Wanda Walker. ref. Crossfire, p 327

data.title: Eddie Piper speaks to Oswald
data.text:
TSBD employee Eddie Piper said he actually spoke to Oswald,
        "Just at twelve o\'clock, down on the first floor".

data.title: Cars seen cruising motorcade area
data.text: Lee Bowers, a railway supervisor located in a tower behind the knoll fence, sees a 1959 Oldsmobile cruise the area. And at 12:20pm, a Black 1957 Ford also did the same and left. Then a third car, a 61 or 62 Chevrolet Impala entered the area, parked out of his sight near the decorative masonry wall, then reappeared immediately after the last shot. ref. Crossfire, pp 75-76

data.title: Oswald seen having lunch
data.text: Carolyn Arnold sees Oswald eating lunch on the second floor lunchroom. "Oswald was sitting in one of the booth seats on the right hand side of the room as you go in. He was alone as usual and appeared to be having lunch. I did not speak to him but I recognized him clearly." ref. Crossfire, p 49; Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 108

data.title: TSBD sixth floor empty
data.text: TSBD employee Bonnie Ray Williams leaves the sixth floor after eating his lunch, he saw nobody. ref. Crossfire, p 49; Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 106

data.title: Man with rifle seen in TSBD
data.text: Witness Arnold Rowland observes man with rifle at the Western end of TSBD. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 300

data.title: Man with seizure in front of TSBD
data.text: A young man suffers some sort of seizure in front of the book depository. ref. Crossfire, p 42

data.title: Police radio for ambulance
data.text: Police radio "code 3" (haste) for ambulance for Dealey Plaza. The ambulance arrived and picked up a suspected epilectic, departing at 12:25 pm. The man was taken to Parkland Hospital where his admittance was never recorded. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 137

data.title: Williams left 6th floor
data.text: Bonnie Ray Williams, left the 6th floor after finishing his lunch and using the elevator joined co workers on the 5th floor to watch the motorcade. ref. Crossfire, p 47.

data.title: Kennedy shot
data.text: President Kennedy shot in Dallas.

data.title: David Ferrie takes mysterious drive
data.text: David Ferrie takes a mysterious 364 mile drive in the afternoon. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 131

data.title: Officers ordered to north of Elm St.
data.text: Police Radio. Bill Decker orders officers to the "Railroad track area just North of Elm St." ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 136

data.title: Washington D.C.\'s phone system breakdown
data.text: Breakdown of Washington D.C.\'s telephone system for almost 1 hour (though Hoover\'s line remains fuctional?). ref. Conspiracy of Silence, p 71

data.title: Oswald leaves TSBD and boards bus
data.text: Lee Harvey Oswald leaves Depository and boards bus. ref. W.C.

data.title: Witness pinpoints window
data.text:
Sergent Harkness reports he has a witness who had pinpointed the window
        (Howard Brennan).

data.title: JFK arrives at Parkland Hospital
data.text: JFK arrives at Parkland Hospital. ref. Best Evidence, p 710

data.title: White male seen running from TSBD
data.text: Police officer Roger Craig sees a white male running down the hill from the direction of the book depository, climbing into a waiting Rambler station wagon, and driving off. ref. Crossfire, p 329

data.title: Oswald gets off bus and boards taxi
data.text: Oswald gets off bus and boards second taxi after allowing a woman to take the first taxi, tells driver William Whaley, "500 North Beckley Street". ref. W.C.

data.title: Suspect\'s description on police radio
data.text:
Description put out about suspect on Dallas police radio. "The wanted person in this is a slender white male about thirty, five feet ten, one sixty five, carrying what looked to be a 30.30 or some type of Winchester".
Officer Tippit told by H/Q dispatcher to "go to central Oakcliff area". ref. Rush to Judgement, p 194

data.title: Police radio assassin\'s location
data.text: Police radio in reference to the location of the assassin. "He is thought to be in the Texas School Book Depository here on the North West corner of Elm and Houston." ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 35

data.title: TSBD ordered cut off
data.text: Captain Talbert gives orders on Police radio, "Have that cut off on the back side will you? Make sure nobody leave there" (refering to the Depository). ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 143

data.title: Homicide Chief calls
data.text: Homicide Chief William Fritz calls in to the dispatchers office from his post at the Trade Mart to ask if JFK will still be going to the site. He is told, "It\'s very doubtful." ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 150

data.title: Office Tippit calls HQ
data.text: Officer Tippit calls into HQ, and is asked if he is in Oakcliff area. He replies, "Yes". ref. Rush to Judgement, p 194

data.title: JFK pronounced dead
data.text: JFK pronounced dead. ref. Best Evidence, p 710

data.title: Police car outside Oswald\'s home
data.text: Police car no. 207 stops outside Oswald\'s rooming house, and sounds horn twice.

data.title: Bullet 399 discovered
data.text: Parkland hospital. Darrell Tomlinson discovers the stretcher bullet 399 which rolls out from under a mat when stretcher bumps the wall. ref. Best Evidence, p 90

data.title: Oswald seen entering Texas Theater
data.text: Oswald enters the Texas Theater according to theater assistant manager shortly after 1:00 pm. ref. Crossfire, p 353

data.title: Oswald seen at bus stop
data.text: Oswald seen standing at bus stop outside his rooming house by his landlady. ref. Rush to Judgement, p 159

data.title: Fake secret service agent pulled over
data.text:
In the South of Dallas, three men are pulled over, one identifies
        himself as a Secret Service agent and states, "We are in a hurry
        to get to New Orleans to investigate part of the shooting."
        However, there is no record of Secret Service being dispatched to
        New Orleans on the day of the assassination.

data.title: Officer Tippit calls HQ twice
data.text: Officer Tippit makes two attempts to call HQ, but dispatcher does not reply. ref. Rush to Judgement, p 195

data.title: Tippit\'s body discovered
data.text: T. F. Bewley comes upon J.D. Tippit\'s body in the street. As he gets out to help he looks at his watch, which reads 1:10pm ref. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 122

data.title: Hulls found on 6th floor of TSBD
data.text: Policeman Luke Mooney finds hulls on sixth floor of Depository. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 143

data.title: Oswald inside Texas theatre
data.text: Oswald buys popcorn at concession stand inside Texas theatre, according to concession stand operator Boroughs. ref. Crossfire, p 353

data.title: Police says Tippit shot
data.text: Police told "Officer Tippit has been shot" by civilian Domingo Benavides using Tippit\'s police car radio. ref. Crossfire, p 348

data.title: TV reports shots heard from Knoll
data.text: Jean Hill in live television report states she heard shots from the Knoll. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 153

data.title: Rifle found on 6th floor of TSBD
data.text:
Rifle found on sixth floor of Book Depository, first identified
        as 7.5 German Mauser.

data.title: Police radio describing Tippit\'s killer
data.text: Police radio call goes out describing Tippit\'s killer as about 30, 5ft 8in black hair and slender. ref. Unanswered Questions, p 105

data.title: Police find white jacket
data.text: Police radio reports finding of a white jacket in parking lot. ref. Rush to Judgement, p 191

data.title: Jack Ruby at Parkland hospital
data.text: Seth Kantor encounters Jack Ruby at Parkland hospital and has brief conversation with him . ref. Crossfire, p 366

data.title: TSBD declared secure
data.text: Police Radio. The TSBD is mentioned, "It\'s secure now." ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 143

data.title: Police radio from Tippit\'s murder scene
data.text: Police radio from scene of Tippit\'s murder, "I got an eyeball witness to the getaway man - that suspect in this shooting. He is a white male ... apparently armed with a .32, dark finish automatic pistol..." ref. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 119

data.title: Police radio of suspect entering Texas theatre
data.text: Police radio, "Have information, a suspect just went into Texas theatre on West Jefferson". ref. Unanswered Questions, p 112

data.title: Oswald arrested at Texas theatre
data.text: Police arrest Oswald at Texas theater as suspect in shooting Tippit. ref. Best Evidence, p 710

data.title: Bullet 399 handed to SS Agent Johnson
data.text: Bullet 399 handed to SS Agent Richard Johnson at Parkland Hospital by Chief of Parkland Hospital security O. P. Wright. ref. Best Evidence, pp 591, 652

data.title: Kennedy\'s body leaves hospital
data.text: Kennedy\'s body leaves Parkland Hospital.

data.title: Kennedy\'s body arrives at airport
data.text: Kennedy\'s body arrives at Lovefield Airport.

data.title: Oswald taken into police dept.
data.text: Oswald taken into Dallas Police Dept. ref. W.C.

data.title: Casket aboard Air Force One
data.text: Casket placed aboard Air Force One.

data.title: Casket aboard Air Force One
data.text: J. Edgar Hoover calls Robert Kennedy to inform him that the killer was an ex-marine who defected to the Soviet Union and was also known to be a pro-communist nut. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 259

data.title: Johnson sworn in aboard Air Force One
data.text: Lyndon Johnson sworn in aboard Air Force One, then orders take off.

data.title: Oswald interrogation
data.text: Oswald interrogation in Office of Captain Will Fritz.

data.title: Air Force One airborne
data.text: Air Force One airborne.

data.title: Police arrives at Paines residence
data.text:
Police officers arrive at the residence of Michael and Ruth Paine,
        Ruth indicates that she has been expecting them.

data.title: Oswald named prime suspect on NBC
data.text:
NBC Newsman Bill Ryan announces on national television that "Lee
        Oswald seems to be prime suspect in the assassination of John
        F. Kennedy."

data.title: White House claims no conspiracy
data.text:
Situation room of the White House communications center informs
        Lyndon Johnson that the assassination is the act of one lone
        individual and that no conspiracy exists.

data.title: Oswald at lineup
data.text:
Oswald taken to first Lineup for Helen Markham, witness to Tippit
        murder. (While waiting outside the lineup room, Oswald is searched,
        and five bullet cartridges are found in his pockets.)

data.title: Oswald interrogated 2nd time
data.text: Second interrogation of Oswald in Captain Fritz\'s Office.

data.title: Air Force One arrives at Washington DC
data.text: Air Force One arrives at Andrews Air Force base Washington D.C., total flight time 2hrs 15min. ref. Best Evidence, p 680

data.title: Deputy sheriff identifies Oswald
data.text: Deputy sheriff Roger Craig identifies Oswald as the man he saw running toward the Rambler station wagon. When asked about the station wagon Oswald replies, "That station wagon belongs to Mrs. Pain, don\'t try to tie her into this. She had nothing to do with it." ref. Rush to Judgement, p 159

data.title: Bullet 399 handed to SS Chief Rowley
data.text: SS Agent Richard Johnson hands bullet 399 to SS Chief Rowley at Executive building in Washington D.C. ref. Best Evidence, p 646

data.title: Oswald taken to second lineup
data.text:
Oswald taken to second lineup, and yells to reporter\'s in hallway,
        "I didn\'t shoot anyone."

data.title: Lineup for witnesses
data.text: Lineup for Witnesses Cecil J. McWatters, Sam Guinyard, and Ted Callaway.

data.title: Oswald charged with Tippit\'s murder
data.text: Oswald charged with Tippit\'s murder. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 5

data.title: Kennedy\'s autopsy
data.text: First incision at Kennedy autopsy.

data.title: Bullet 399 sent to FBI Lab
data.text: SS Chief Rowley sends bullet 399 to FBI laboratory. ref. Best Evidence, p 646

data.title: Oswald taken to 3rd lineup
data.text: Oswald taken to third lineup for witness J. D. Davies.

data.title: Oswald yells at reporters
data.text: Oswald yells at reporters in hallway "I\'m just a patsy". ref. (Entry in Seth Kantor\'s notebook) Treachery in Dallas, p 293

data.title: 3rd interrogation of Oswald
data.text: Third interrogation of Oswald in Captain Fritz\'s Office.

data.title: Oswald\'s fingerprints, ID tests
data.text: Oswald\'s fingerprints, identification, Paraffin tests - all in Fritz\'s Office.

data.title: Oswald \'talked to\' by FBI
data.text: Oswald "Talked to" by FBI Agent M. Clements and Police Officer John Adamcik.

data.title: Oswald taken to press conference
data.text:
Oswald is taken to press conference. Oswald is asked if he is a member
        of the Free Cuba Committee, but before he answers, Jack Ruby standing
        up the back, corrects the reporter and says, "That\'s the Fair Play for
        Cuba Committee". Oswald is asked by a reporter, "Did you kill President
        Kennedy?" Oswald replies, "No, I have not been charged with that. In
        fact nobody has said that to me yet. The first thing I heard about that
        is when the newspaper reporters asked me that question." Oswald is told
        by a reporter, "That you have been charged" (with the murder of Kennedy.)
        Oswald looks baffled as he is lead away.

data.title: Oswald charged with JFK\'s murder
data.text: Oswald charged with President Kennedy\'s murder. (Oswald is not told of this charge).

data.title: FBI tells Thomlinson stay quiet
data.text: Darrell Thomlinson is awakened by a phone call from the FBI, and is told to keep his mouth shut about the bullet he found on the stretcher at Parkland Hospital. ref. Best Evidence, p 591

data.title: 3rd set of evidence taken
data.text: Oswald complains, "That this is the third set of fingerprints, photographs being taken." ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 49

data.title: Oswald told of JFK\'s murder charge
data.text: Oswald officialy told that he has been charged with JFK\'s murder. ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 49

data.title: McCoy told Oswald to be killed
data.text:
Sheriff officer Perry McCoy receives a phone call from a "white
        male" who says that Oswald is going to be killed during his
        transfer.

data.title: Grammer receives phone call
data.text:
Police lieutenant Billy Grammer also receives a phone call. The
        caller asks specifically to speak to Grammer and says, "You know me".
        He describes in detail the plan to move Oswald and tells him that other
        arrangements should be made or, "We are going to kill Oswald right
        there in the basement".

data.title: All evidence to Washington DC
data.text: FBI Special Agent Vince Drain transports the gun and all other evidence to Washington D.C. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 28

data.title: Interrogation of Oswald
data.text: Interrogation of Oswald, Captain Fritz\'s office. ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 49

data.title: Oswald visited by mother, wife
data.text: Oswald visited by Mother, Margurite, and Wife Marina. ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 50

data.title: Lineup
data.text: Lineup for Witness William Scoggins and William Whaley. ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 50

data.title: Robert Oswald visits Lee Oswald
data.text:
Robert Oswald visits Lee for 10 Minutes. Lee tells Robert,
        "Don\'t believe all the so-called evidence."

data.title: Oswald calls Ruth Paine
data.text:
Lee Oswald calls Ruth Paine and asks her. "Would you please call
        John Abt (Lawyer) in New York for me after 6:00 pm."

data.title: Kennedy\'s body returns to White House
data.text: Kennedy\'s body returns to the White House. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 5

data.title: Nichols visits Oswald
data.text: Oswald has visit with H. Louis Nichols, President of the Dallas Bar Association.

data.title: Oswald shown photo of him with gun
data.text:
Interrogation in Captain Fritz\'s Office, Oswald is shown the backyard photo
        of him with gun. "That picture is not my mine. The picture has been made
        by superimposing my face. The other part of the picture is not me at all,
        I have never seen this picture before. I understand photography real well,
        and that in time, I will be able to show you that this is not my picture
        and that it was made by someone else."

data.title: Interrogation
data.text: Interrogation in Captain Fritz\'s Office. ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 51

data.title: Nurse Lozana warned of emergency
data.text: Registered Nurse Bertha Lozana recalls, "At 11:00 a.m. I was informed by Jill Pomeroy, the ward clerk, that we might prepare for an emergency because there was a large crowd at city hall". ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 169

data.title: Preparation of Oswald\'s transfer
data.text: Preparation for Oswald\'s transfer to County Jail. ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 52

data.title: Final conversation with Oswald
data.text: Inspector Thomas J. Kelly Secret Service, has final conversation with Oswald. ref. The Peoples Almanac, p 52

data.title: Jack Ruby wires money order
Jack Ruby shoots Oswald
data.text: Jack Ruby shoots Oswald in basement carpark of Dallas police dept. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 203

data.title: Jack Ruby told Oswald dead
data.text: On being told that Oswald is dead, Jack Ruby calms down in his cell at Dallas Police Station. ref. Framed, p 41

data.title: Johnson signs NSAM 273
data.text: President Johnson signs NSAM 273, signalling a reversal to JFK\'s policy of withdrawing troops from Vietnam. ref. JFK, CIA and Vietnam by Prouty, p 422

data.title: FBI agent at funeral home
data.text: FBI Agent Richard Harrison arrives at Miller\'s Funeral Home with rifle (type unknown) and finger print ink. Funeral Director would tell researchers that he could not understand the event and that he had a very difficult time getting the black ink off Oswald\'s corpse. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 332

data.title: Warren Commission established
data.text: Warren Commission established.

data.title: Warren Commission hears first witness
data.text: Warren Commission hears first witness.

data.title: Johnson appoints Hoover as FBI Director
data.text: J. Edgar Hoover is appointed as FBI Director for life by Lyndon Johnson

data.title: Hoover before Warren Commission
data.text:
J. Edgar Hoover appears before the Warren Commission and commits at
        least three acts of perjury.

data.title: Jack Ruby dies in prison
data.text: Jack Ruby dies in prison. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 330

data.title: Jack Ruby diagnosed with cancer
data.text: Jack Ruby diagnosed with cancer. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 330

data.title: Phillips confides about conspiracy
data.text:
David Atlee Phillips confiding in a House Select Committee staffer
        Kevin Walgh shortly before his death. "My private opinion is that
        JFK was done in by a conspiracy, likely including rogue American
        Intelligence people".
